summary: The httxt2dbm utility converts RewriteMap text files to DBM databases for use by the Apache HTTP server. It reads key-value pairs from a text file and stores them in a DBM database file with support for various DBM formats.

logs.message_template: %s -- Program to Create DBM Files for use by RewriteMap
logs.reason: Displays program name and purpose when showing the usage information
logs.resolution: Informational message only, no resolution required

logs.reason: Shows the command-line syntax when displaying usage information
logs.resolution: Informational message only, no resolution required

logs.reason: Header for the options section in the usage information
logs.resolution: Informational message only, no resolution required

logs.reason: Explains the verbose option in the usage information
logs.resolution: Informational message only, no resolution required

logs.message_template: -i    Source Text File. If '-', use stdin.
logs.reason: Explains the input file option in the usage information
logs.resolution: Informational message only, no resolution required

logs.reason: Explains the output file option in the usage information
logs.resolution: Informational message only, no resolution required

logs.message_template: -f    DBM Format.  If not specified, will use the APR Default.
logs.reason: Explains the format option in the usage information
logs.resolution: Informational message only, no resolution required

logs.reason: Shows GDBM format availability in the usage information
logs.resolution: Informational message only, no resolution required

logs.reason: Shows SDBM format availability in the usage information
logs.resolution: Informational message only, no resolution required

logs.reason: Shows Berkeley DB format availability in the usage information
logs.resolution: Informational message only, no resolution required

logs.reason: Shows NDBM format availability in the usage information
logs.resolution: Informational message only, no resolution required

logs.message_template: default for the default DBM type
logs.reason: Explains the default DBM format option in the usage information
logs.resolution: Informational message only, no resolution required

logs.reason: Shows key-value pairs being added to the DBM when in verbose mode
logs.resolution: Informational message only, no resolution required

logs.reason: Indicates a failure in initializing the argument parsing system
logs.resolution: This is likely a system-level issue. Check system resources and restart the application.

logs.message_template: Error: -v can only be passed once
logs.reason: User provided the verbose flag multiple times in the command line
logs.resolution: Remove duplicate -v flags from the command line

logs.message_template: Error: -f can only be passed once
logs.reason: User provided the format flag multiple times in the command line
logs.resolution: Remove duplicate -f flags and specify the format only once

logs.message_template: Error: -i can only be passed once
logs.reason: User provided the input file flag multiple times in the command line
logs.resolution: Remove duplicate -i flags and specify the input file only once

logs.message_template: Error: -o can only be passed once
logs.reason: User provided the output file flag multiple times in the command line
logs.resolution: Remove duplicate -o flags and specify the output file only once

logs.reason: The command-line arguments could not be parsed correctly
logs.resolution: Check the command-line syntax and ensure all arguments are properly formatted

logs.reason: The required input file parameter is missing
logs.resolution: Specify an input file with the -i option

logs.reason: The required output DBM parameter is missing
logs.resolution: Specify an output DBM file with the -o option

logs.reason: Shows the DBM format being used when in verbose mode
logs.resolution: Informational message only, no resolution required

logs.reason: Failed to open the specified input file, possibly due to permission issues or the file not existing
logs.resolution: Check that the input file exists, has the correct permissions, and the path is correctly specified

logs.reason: Shows the input file path when in verbose mode
logs.resolution: Informational message only, no resolution required

logs.message_template: Error: The requested DBM Format '%s' is not available.
logs.reason: The specified DBM format is not supported by the current APR installation
logs.resolution: Choose a different DBM format that is available on your system, or reinstall APR with support for the desired format

logs.reason: Failed to open or create the output DBM file, possibly due to permission issues or directory not existing
logs.resolution: Check that the output directory exists, has the correct permissions, and the path is correctly specified

logs.reason: Shows the output DBM file path when in verbose mode
logs.resolution: Informational message only, no resolution required

logs.reason: An error occurred during the conversion process from text to DBM format
logs.resolution: Check that the input file is properly formatted with valid key-value pairs and that there is sufficient disk space for the output

logs.reason: Indicates successful completion of the conversion process when in verbose mode
logs.resolution: Informational message only, no resolution required
